messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: guns/how long
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/2/2001 9:16:52 PM Central Daylight Time, tlcamy@tds.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/2/2001 9:16:52 PM Central Daylight Time, tlcamy@...
writes:

<< so Candace how long has this type of thing gone on in the past and does
the list owner/moderator intervene on? >>

Oh some threads go on a long time, but sometimes they are interesting to
watch. Usually they go on a long time when they are about explosive issues. I
do not mind seeing (reading) a good debate but it can get a bit tiresome if
it becomes less of a debate and more of an attack on someone's opinions, or
even worse, someone's life or lifestyle. Being an unschooling list I think
the moderator/owner feels that there is learning in everything and all is
unschooling. So looking at it that way it makes sense to let the debates go
on. I am not certain why Lynda said I like to play "tag team." (Not even sure
what that is, we just play tag here.) Anyway, I have expressed opinions on
subjects in the past just not as often as some. I guess Lynda and I do not
agree too often. I try to have a live and let live attitude. I feel that I
have no right to tell others how to live their lives or tell them that what
they are doing is wrong. Lynda has not given me that same consideration. I no
longer feel free to express what is going on in our lives here unless I am in
the mood to defend it.
The majority of the time it is an interesting, fun list. Hang in there, till
a subject interests you. One will!
Have a fun day
Candace
